title: 110_hr642
content:
The Act is named the "Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones College Fire Prevention Act" and establishes the Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones Fire Suppression Demonstration Incentive Program. The "Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones College Fire Prevention Act" establishes a demonstration program for awarding grants to install fire suppression technologies in student housing. Eligible entities include institutions of higher education and tax-exempt social fraternities or sororities. The "Honorable Stephanie Tubbs Jones College Fire Prevention Act" establishes a grant program for fire suppression technologies in student housing. Priority is given to entities with financial need, and a reserved amount is allocated to eligible institutions under the Higher Education Act. The Secretary will develop a plan to inform eligible entities about applying for grants under the Higher Education Act. If there are not enough qualified applicants, the remaining reserved funds will be available for other eligible entities to use when seeking a grant. To apply for a grant under this program, eligible entities must submit an application to the Secretary with required information. Applicants must provide non-Federal matching funds equal to at least 50% of the activity costs. The funds should supplement, not replace, other sources for fire safety activities. Administrative expenses for a grant are limited to 2%. Reports must be submitted within 12 months of receiving the grant. The Secretary must provide Congress with annual reports on the grant program, detailing the number and types of eligible entities receiving assistance, the financial information including non-Federal funding leveraged, student housing equipped with fire suppression technologies, and the types and costs of technologies installed. Authorization of Appropriations: Sums are authorized for fiscal years 2009 through 2011 to carry out the program improving fire safety in student housing by evaluating impediments to technology development and installation. SEC. 3. ADMISSIBILITY AS EVIDENCE.

Prohibits the use of any application for assistance, negative determination, or statement of reasons under this Act as evidence in any court proceeding, except in cases related to enforcing agreements with eligible entities.
